segment.source: If you want to test Manufacturing Mode, you can enable it by using ffutool.exe or by using a BCD setting.
segment.target: If you want to test Manufacturing Mode, you can enable it by using ffutool.exe or by using a BCD setting.

segment.source: Enable or Disable Manufacturing Mode
segment.target: Enable or Disable Manufacturing Mode

segment.source: Enable or Disable Manufacturing Mode
segment.target: Enable or Disable Manufacturing Mode

segment.source: If you want to test Manufacturing Mode, you can enable it by using ffutool.exe or by using a BCD setting.
segment.target: If you want to test Manufacturing Mode, you can enable it by using ffutool.exe or by using a BCD setting.

segment.source: Note The recommended way to support manufacturing mode on shipping devices is to have the firmware support the Boot mode management UEFI protocol.
segment.target: Note The recommended way to support manufacturing mode on shipping devices is to have the firmware support the Boot mode management UEFI protocol.

segment.source: For more info on this protocol, see Boot mode management UEFI protocol.
segment.target: For more info on this protocol, see Boot mode management UEFI protocol.

segment.source: Enable or disable Manufacturing Mode with ffutool.exe
segment.target: Enable or disable Manufacturing Mode with ffutool.exe

segment.source: If the device supports the boot mode UEFI protocol, you can enable or disable Manufacturing Mode with ffutool.exe by using the setBootMode parameter.
segment.target: If the device supports the boot mode UEFI protocol, you can enable or disable Manufacturing Mode with ffutool.exe by using the setBootMode parameter.

segment.source: The syntax is as follows:
segment.target: The syntax is as follows:

segment.source: boot mode -- an integer that corresponds to the boot mode documented in EFIBOOTMODEINFO enumeration.
segment.target: boot mode -- an integer that corresponds to the boot mode documented in EFIBOOTMODEINFO enumeration.

segment.source: profile name -- the name of the manufacturing profile to enable.
segment.target: profile name -- the name of the manufacturing profile to enable.

segment.source: This is required when the boot mode is set to 1 and is ignored when the boot mode is set to 0.
segment.target: This is required when the boot mode is set to 1 and is ignored when the boot mode is set to 0.

segment.source: The following example enables Manufacturing Mode and uses a manufacturing profile named CustomProfile:
segment.target: The following example enables Manufacturing Mode and uses a manufacturing profile named CustomProfile:

segment.source: The following example disables Manufacturing Mode, allowing the operating system to boot normally:
segment.target: The following example disables Manufacturing Mode, allowing the operating system to boot normally:

segment.source: Enable Manufacturing Mode with a BCD setting
segment.target: Enable Manufacturing Mode with a BCD setting

segment.source: You can use the MfgMode BCD setting to test Manufacturing Mode with your custom manufacturing profiles.
segment.target: You can use the MfgMode BCD setting to test Manufacturing Mode with your custom manufacturing profiles.

segment.source: MfgMode is a string value that is set to the name of your custom manufacturing profile.
segment.target: MfgMode is a string value that is set to the name of your custom manufacturing profile.

segment.source: For example, you can start the device in Manufacturing Mode using the default manufacturing profile by running the following command on the device:
segment.target: For example, you can start the device in Manufacturing Mode using the default manufacturing profile by running the following command on the device:

segment.source: Or, you could start the device in Manufacturing Mode using a custom manufacturing profile named, CustomProfile, by doing the following:
segment.target: Or, you could start the device in Manufacturing Mode using a custom manufacturing profile named, CustomProfile, by doing the following:

segment.source: You can also enable it on an offline device that is plugged in and is in USB mass storage mode.
segment.target: You can also enable it on an offline device that is plugged in and is in USB mass storage mode.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Note If you're using an older version of bcdedit.exe, you might have to use custom:22000140 instead of mfgmode as the BCD setting name.
segment.target: Note If you're using an older version of bcdedit.exe, you might have to use custom:22000140 instead of mfgmode as the BCD setting name.

segment.source: Create a Manufacturing Mode BCD package
segment.target: Create a Manufacturing Mode BCD package

segment.source: You can create a package that creates the MfgMode BCD entry and sets it to your custom manufacturing profile.
segment.target: You can create a package that creates the MfgMode BCD entry and sets it to your custom manufacturing profile.

segment.source: To do this, you must first create an XML file that references the BCD entry:
segment.target: To do this, you must first create an XML file that references the BCD entry:

segment.source: After that is created, you can reference it in a package XML file:
segment.target: After that is created, you can reference it in a package XML file:

segment.source: Note There is a Partition attribute defining that these BCD entries need to apply to the EFIESP partition.
segment.target: Note There is a Partition attribute defining that these BCD entries need to apply to the EFIESP partition.

segment.source: This should be updated to be the partition where the BCD store for your device resides.
segment.target: This should be updated to be the partition where the BCD store for your device resides.

segment.source: If this is different from the partition where the main operating system resides, other operations such as adding files and registry keys to the main operating system partition cannot be done from the same package.
segment.target: If this is different from the partition where the main operating system resides, other operations such as adding files and registry keys to the main operating system partition cannot be done from the same package.

segment.source: To create the package, you can use pkggen.exe (included with the Windows Driver Kit):
